title: Une étape indispensable
text: Située dans une charmante maison du centre de Ouidah, juste derrière la cahtédrale, la fondation est à visiter pour le charme de la maison d'où on peut admirer de belles vus sur la ville sur les multiples fenêtres qui aèrent le bâtiment, mais aussi pour les expositions temporaires d'art africain contemporain, qui montrent le dynamisme de la création africaine tissant des ponts entre traditions culturelles et expression moderne.

placeInfo.name: Fondation Zinsou
placeInfo.address: 7012 Rue des Missions, R Opposite of Central Police Station, Cotonou 01BP7053 Benin

translated_text: Located in a charming house in the center of Ouidah, just behind the cathedral, the foundation is worth visiting for the charm of the house from where you can admire beautiful views of the city through the many windows that ventilate the building, but also for the temporary exhibitions of contemporary African art, which show the dynamism of African creation weaving bridges between cultural traditions and modern expression.

title: Museum has been closed
text: Just visited the foundation today. The museum has been closed since December 2019 and is not planning to be opened anytime soon in Cotonou. The staff here says that theres a museum in Ouida that’s currently open. What’s left of the museum here is just a shop of books and textiles. It also acts as a cafe, although the cafe staff is not very friendly. When I asked if there’s a book about the museum history (since the museum is closed and I came all the way), they pointed me to a book. However, to sit down and read it, they demanded me to buy something to drink at the cafe. Or I could not use the chairs and had to stand. There was no other customer and all seats were empty. In the end, I had to stand there glancing through the book. This experience left a rather bad taste in the mouth and in my few contradictory to what the foundation is about - advocating the art of Africa. For future visitors, may best visit the museum in Ouida.

title: Such a lovely museum!  Really enjoyed talking with the staff
text: This is an essential resource for anyone interested in culture or art in Benin. I saw the wax fabric exhibit and the history of Cotonou exhibit, both of which were beautiful and interesting. The guide did an exceptional job of balancing being informative with letting us explore and process on our own. I also enjoyed the shop - perfect for buying unique gifts and a milkshake.

title: Un peu de culture ...
text:
Passage fait en février 2019.
Tout d'abord, la bonne adresse ... Cette fondation n'est plus dans le quartier Cadjéhoun (l'adresse donnée dans le petit futé est obsolète)(comme la moitié du guide Bénin 2018 d'ailleurs !!!).
Préciser face au commissariat central au zem et c'est bon.
Excellent accueil dans un endroit climatisé. Visite gratuite sur 3 étages !
Compter 1 h 30 à 2 h de visite.
Notre guide Anita nous a fait découvrir l'exposition,"L'Afrique n'est pas une île" !
Photographies, peintures, art contemporain, sculptures, et histoire de Cotonou.
A faire sans modération car c'est malheureusement un des rares endroits culturels de Cotonou.
Joli coin boutique pour finir la visite. Les jus de fruits sont excellents.
Et pour les accrocs du net, il y a du WIFI !!!

placeInfo.name: Fondation Zinsou
placeInfo.address: 7012 Rue des Missions, R Opposite of Central Police Station, Cotonou 01BP7053 Benin

translated_text: Visited in February 2019. First of all, the right address... This foundation is no longer in the Cadjéhoun district (the address given in the Petit Futé is obsolete) (like half of the 2018 Benin guide, by the way!!!). Ask in front of the central police station at the zem and you're good to go. Excellent welcome in an air-conditioned place. Free tour on 3 floors! Allow 1.5 to 2 hours for the visit. Our guide Anita showed us the exhibition, "Africa is not an island"! Photographs, paintings, contemporary art, sculptures, and the history of Cotonou. To do without moderation because it is unfortunately one of the rare cultural places in Cotonou. Nice boutique corner to end the visit. The fruit juices are excellent. And for internet addicts, there is WIFI!!!

title: Punaisen dösän taidemuseo
text:
Kohde löytyy keskustan tuntumasta. Taksi tuntui hyvin paikan tunnistavan punaisesta museon bussista. (Sijaitsee rakennuksen edessä)

Ilmainen sisäänpääsy ja suht hyvää englantia puhuva opas kiersi mukana kertomassa Benin maan historiasta ja valokuvien (käynnin aikana valokuva näyttely parilla kolmella videolla höystettynä) taustoista. 

Monikerroksinen rakennus (ei hissiä) säätiön käytössä. Kierroksen jälkeen mahdollisuus Beninissä valmistettujen tuotteiden ostoon sekä kahvilassa oleiluun. 

Kahvilassa myös ilmainen wifi. 

Jos kaupungissa käyt on kohde käymisen arvoinen.

title: One of a kind phenomenal
text: This museum and educational foundation is not to be missed in any trip to Benin. Even if you don’t know anything about contemporary African Art— or, like me, think maybe you secretly don’t even like contemporary art very much, because sometimes it’s so hard to grasp— I entreat you to visit this place! The exhibition guides are so well trained and explain the art in a plain-spoken, very clear and interactive way that is both enlightening and enjoyable. It’s a wonderful place for kids, families, art experts and newcomers to contemporary art alike. I’ve visited art museums around the world and have never seen one quite like this. A super special place.

title: Incontournable de l'art contemporain africain
text:
Voici l'un des incontournables de Cotonou. La fondation Zinsou propose des expositions d'art contemporain africain, actuellement une sélection de la collection de la fondation, beaucoup de photographie.
Si la fondation perd part son architecture comparée à son alter-égo de Ouidah (dans un très beau bâtiment colonial) elle gagne par les œuvres exposées, les expositions qui s'y succèdent et la qualité des guides pour la visite. Guide connaissant les œuvres sur le bout des doigts mais aussi au courant de l'actualité des expositions sur l'art africain dans le monde, des artistes d'autres pays, bref super visite!
La boutique est aussi un incontournable axée sur les catalogues d'exposition et de nombreux objets en tissu coloré. Dur de se retenir d'acheter quelque chose malgré les prix très élevés.

placeInfo.name: Fondation Zinsou
placeInfo.address: 7012 Rue des Missions, R Opposite of Central Police Station, Cotonou 01BP7053 Benin

translated_title: A must-see in contemporary African art
translated_text: This is one of Cotonou's must-sees. The Zinsou Foundation offers exhibitions of contemporary African art, currently a selection from the foundation's collection, and a lot of photography. While the foundation loses out in terms of architecture compared to its counterpart in Ouidah (in a beautiful colonial building), it wins in terms of the works on display, the exhibitions that follow one another, and the quality of the guides for the tour. The guide knows the works inside out but is also up to date on current exhibitions on African art around the world, artists from other countries—in short, a great visit! The shop is also a must-see, focusing on exhibition catalogs and many colorful fabric objects. It's hard to resist buying something despite the very high prices.

title: Incontournable
text:
Après Ouidah, Cotonou et encore une fois bravo pour la qualité de la collection. Photographes, peintres et sculpteurs représentent parfaitement l'art contemporain béninois et ouest africain, des artistes occidentaux sont aussi exposés. Musée climatisé et clair où la visite est guidé par des passionnés, merci Jonas pour ce partage. 
Nous avons déjeuné ensuite au café restaurant du musée et ce fut très agréable, nous recommandons vivement!

placeInfo.name: Fondation Zinsou
placeInfo.address: 7012 Rue des Missions, R Opposite of Central Police Station, Cotonou 01BP7053 Benin

translated_text: After Ouidah, Cotonou and once again congratulations for the quality of the collection. Photographers, painters and sculptors perfectly represent contemporary Beninese and West African art, Western artists are also exhibited. Air-conditioned and bright museum where the tour is guided by enthusiasts, thank you Jonas for sharing this. We then had lunch at the museum's café restaurant and it was very pleasant, we highly recommend it!

The purchases made up for the disappointment of not seeing an exhibition...

text: Endroit très agréable. Calme. Jolie déco. Très bonne table quoique peu variée. Excellents jus locaux . Service impeccable . Très bonne connexion wifi. N'oubliez pas d'aller au bar tout en couleur rien que pour la dégustation de l'œil… à suivre à la Maison Rouge le magasin d'accessoire et de mode de Zinsou

The bottom is more creative than the top which is falling apart a little… Especially a big bravo to the team who raises awareness among children about contemporary art with a unique workshop. Don't forget to go to the colorful bar just for the tasting of the eye… to follow at the Maison Rouge, the Zinsou accessories and fashion store

title: Guides classe en noeud papillon noir et chemises rouges
text:
La fondation Zinsou est dorénavant face au commissariat central de Cotonou.
Il y avait des œuvres de Zinkpe qui dirige l antenne de la fondation Valois de Cotonou lorsque nous sommes passes. Il faut remarquer les ateliers petits pinceaux destines aux enfants béninois passionnes par la peinture.
La cafeteria propose des glaces raffinées au corrosol ou à la manque.

placeInfo.name: Fondation Zinsou
placeInfo.address: 7012 Rue des Missions, R Opposite of Central Police Station, Cotonou 01BP7053 Benin

translated_title: Classy guides in black bow ties and red shirts
translated_text: The Zinsou Foundation is now located opposite the Cotonou central police station. There were works by Zinkpe, who runs the Valois Foundation branch in Cotonou, on display when we passed by. Noteworthy are the small brush workshops for Beninese children who are passionate about painting. The cafeteria offers refined soursop or mango ice cream.

title: Good art books and five dollar per night hotel
text: I got here cause I was looking for a budget hotel near the embassies and the sea. Really near to the airport too and there's only five planes a day that fly over. I managed to pay 3000 per night cause I stayed five nights. Spent good times talking to Jules, the landlord and the girls of the tailor school right next door. The foundation does a good job, being well visited by eager kids that wash their hands before entering and picking up any books. They had a great Keith Haring exhibition last November and so I spent a good afternoon reading into the African inspiration that Keith drew. No airco but fans. Same as in the budget 'hotel'.

title: A great cause and an excellent museum shop
text: There was almost nothing on display  in the Cotonou headquarters when we were there, because it had all been sent to their branch in Ouidah. Luckily that town was on our itinerary and we could see the expo there.  Great choice of contemporary African art from anywhere on the continent, not just Benin.  There are gift shops at both sites, the Cotonou one having a greater selection.  There is a museum café in both; we had lunch at the one in Ouidah and can thoroughly recommend it for casual and groovy ambience as well as the food.

title: Trop snob
text:
L idée d une fondation  et l acces a la culture sont très bonnes.
Mais dans le contexte Beninois l exposition sur keith Haring est déplacée et ne colle pas avec l environnement.  Cette exposition est plutôt à destination d une certaine elite de la population. 
Il faudrait se rapprocher plus de la culture Beninoise et africaine afin que le commun de la population puisse s en identifier.

placeInfo.name: Fondation Zinsou
placeInfo.address: 7012 Rue des Missions, R Opposite of Central Police Station, Cotonou 01BP7053 Benin

translated_text: The idea of a foundation and access to culture are very good. But in the Beninese context, the Keith Haring exhibition is out of place and does not fit with the environment. This exhibition is rather aimed at a certain elite of the population. We should get closer to Beninese and African culture so that the general population can identify with it.

title: History & Culture For Emotion
text:
It is a modern museum in Ouidah. I was there in May 2015 and I was amazed. There are many pictures of art, photos images, Dahomey’s kings’ representations and emblems and there smart persons to explain you what is the meaning of each one.
Is a very good museum. Don’t forget looking at ‘Le Fou du village’. This one have a story that you would surely go to forget.
But coming there, look first ‘Le temple des Pythons’. Have fun.

La fondation Zinsou est un espace qui met en valeur la culture béninoise et africaine. J'ai beaucoup aimé les expositions de nos artistes et l'assistance des hôtes pour mieux comprendre les œuvres.  Il y a un wifi qui permet de se connecter et naviguer sur internet. 

très bel espace culturel.

Par contre je mets en garde les francais du Nigeria qui passeront la frontiere en venant de Lagos , un systeme de corruption vous attend et de grosses sommes d argent vous seront estorquees afin de vous laisser entrer !!!!!

title: Very nice shop
text:
I came here twice, one in February (before the elections) and then back in March (just after). In February the foundation was open but the exposition was closed, I could only pick up some ideas thanks to a digital show of the African artists which had their art exposed in the museum. That was possible by using the tablet given by the kind museum attendants and a wall info panel. The idea I got is that would have been so nice to see everything live. Unfortunately it was not clear why there was not opened exposition.

I could instead visit the shop that sells fabrics and other various artisanal products which are the best I have seen in the all country (only entering in direct contact with a woman that does batik I got similar quality). The shop is much better for quality and price than all shops in the artisanal center in Cotonou and dedicated shops in big hotels which I visited because after the elections I came back and the Foundation was completely closed. Even the shop. 

That was a pity. I would have enjoyed a lot a visit to the contemporary African art showed here.

title: Contemporary African Art by Locals
text:
Our ship docked about 2 miles from the center of this French influenced community. Taxi availability is very limited. We opted for a ship's tour that would include the city highlights and a trip to the Ganvie Village on stilts. 

After a 45 minute drive through the scenic countryside, we arrived at Calavi Harbor where we embarked a motorized canoe for the 30 minute cruise across Nakoue Lake enroute to Ganvie. Along the way there were plenty of opportunities to observe the local people going about their daily chores aboard dugout canoes. The large village is a bustling of commerce .Residences and businesses are perched on stilts above the Everglades like waterway. The village was founded about 500 years ago to protect the villagers from warrior factions who were prevented from entering the water for religious reasons.  Don't miss the opportunity to visit this rustic time. An hour or so floating through the village is sufficient.

Returning to Cotonou, we stopped at the Foundation Zinaou, a museum containing an interesting array of art by local artists. There are various exhibits of photography, paintings, screenings, and sculpture. There's a small cafe on the first floor that's a comfortable spot to grab a bite.

Il devient vite l'incontournable des pauses dans Cotonou.

title: The Café is the best bit
text:
It is a shop for good quality locally produced crafts, mostly clothes, bags, jewellery. There are sometimes exhibitions but not when we visited in late December 2015. And the items are expensive, almost European prices.
At the back is a nice café which serves Nespresso coffee, good ice cream and juices and good lunches. But expect to pay 10 euros each.

title: Plus pour l'´initiative que pour le lieu
text:
Une exposition de Romuald Azoumé etait en cours , tres politique et constituée d'oeuvres assez monumentales .
Un reproche quand meme  , trop peu d'oeuvre , c'est dommage !
Les guides sont tres bien formés et la boutique est magnifique et pleine de beaux objets .

title: Très instructif
text: Beau musée gratuit, avec la visite guidée. On apprend beaucoup de choses sur le pays (expo Romuald Hazoumè) au niveau de son fonctionnement, de sa politique. le guide connaissait son sujet, et était très intéressant. J'ai été ravie de cette visite.

placeInfo.name: Fondation Zinsou

title: Arte en Cotonou
text:
Conocí el centro cultural de Cotonou y sus directores y empleados, gente maravillosa y super amable.
Arte como el que vi allí no lo vi en mi vida, ni en París, Madrid, San Pablo ni niguna parte en la que haya estado. Arte en estado puro.
Quien tenga la oportunidad de entrar en sus vidas, que lo haga, son personas maravillosas y amables que te enseñan cosas de otro mundo.

placeInfo.name: Fondation Zinsou
placeInfo.address: 7012 Rue des Missions, R Opposite of Central Police Station, Cotonou 01BP7053 Benin

Arte como el que vi allí no lo vi en mi vida, ni en Paris, Madrid, San Pablo niguna parte en la que haya estado. Arte en estado puro. Whoever took the opportunity to enter into his life, that he has, his happy and friendly people who teach you the things of other world.

title: Une belle initiative
text:
Galerie d'art contemporain avec des expo temporaires tous les 6/9 mois.
Le lieu est bien tenu et les guides connaissent bien les détails des pièces exposées.
Petit café à l'arrière avec une décoration qui change régulièrement, très calme.
Une belle initiative pour promouvoir l'art contemporain africain.
La petite boutique de la fondation propose des accessoires en tissu africain mais à mon gout pas assez d'articles sur l'art africain ou l'exposition en elle même...

placeInfo.name: Fondation Zinsou

translated_text: Contemporary art gallery with temporary exhibitions every 6-9 months. The place is well-maintained and the guides are knowledgeable about the pieces on display. Small café at the back with a decor that changes regularly, very quiet. A great initiative to promote contemporary African art. The foundation's small shop sells African fabric accessories, but in my opinion, there aren't enough articles on African art or the exhibition itself...

title: De très belle expositions
text:
C'est un endroit très agréable pour oublier ce qui se passe autour.
Le temps d'une visite vous serez embarqué dans la culture béninoise et africaine en plus générale. Les expositions ne m'ont jamais déçues et sont vraiment intéressante, également pour les plus jeunes. N'hésitez pas !

title: un endroit agréable à Cotonou ou Ouidah
text: On est toujours bien accueilli par la fondation que ce soit à Cotonou ou Ouidah, Les expositions sont intéressantes, les lieux agréables et le personnel est compétent et sympathique.

placeInfo.name: Fondation Zinsou
placeInfo.address: 7012 Rue des Missions, R Opposite of Central Police Station, Cotonou 01BP7053 Benin

translated_title: a nice place in Cotonou or Ouidah
translated_text: We are always well received by the foundation whether in Cotonou or Ouidah. The exhibitions are interesting, the places pleasant and the staff is competent and friendly.

title: Good exhibition site, competent staff
text:
They have contemporary artists on exhibition. It is not a very big site, however, it's well laid out and conveniently located. We had been there when the show of gerard quenum was on, which consisted of medium-sized canvases. They seem to do one-artist-shows there predominantly, which seems to be a reasonable choice given the limited size, but they have done group exhibitions as well (obviously, one on the impact and crosscultural influences of Basquiat).

The staff was friendly and competent. I bought pretty good souvenirs from the gift shop (woven bags for the kids, handicrafts) which were better than average and not too overpriced. 

They just opened a branch in Ouidah, which covers a bigger scope of African contemporary art, with a showpiece of the major artists each (bruly boulabre, cheri samba, several hazoume photos etc), so it seems to be a bit more Beninish in Cotonou, and a bit more panafrican in Ouidah, but that may just have been a coincidence. both spaces are worth seeing, anyway, I will surely come back.

Ce musée est très pédagogique, d'ailleurs plusieurs enfants écoutaient et très absorbés par la description des œuvres.
Nouveauté: au moins de novembre, un autre musée de la fondationZinsou ouvrait à Ouidha...
Allez faire un tour...

New: in November, another Zinsou Foundation museum opened in Ouidha... Go take a look...

title: Beninois Art
text: Fondation Zinsou is one of the very few places where you can get to see modern art by Benin artists in a global context.  At their headquarters in Cadjehoun, there is always an exhibit going on that continues for 3 months or more.  But what I like most is its excellent museum shop, and its activities to bring school children to the museum and its libraries.  A Foundation with a real, noble spirit.  Its Musée in Ouidah is even more interesting.

title: Einfach  ein " Muss" bei  jedem Aufenthalt in Cotonou
text: Die von der Architektur und vom Spirit außergewöhnliche Fondation ist ein Highlight für das im Grunde besichtigungsarme  Cotonou. Inzwischen hat diese Fonadation sich in der internationalen Kunstszene einen Namen gemacht. Kommende  und auch bereits arrivierte afrikanische Künstler  haben hier die Wände, um ihre Werke zu präsentieren. Das haben auch die Kunstaufkäufer aus Europa und den USA erkannt. Sie kaufen hier im Großen ein und bringen diese Werke u ein Vielfaches höher auf den dortigen Markt. Für neue Künstler selbst ist die Fondation Zinssou eine erstklassige Plattform , um mit einer Einzelausstellung  bekannt zu werden.

BernardO
